citations.narrative:
1. In Room 1014 there was flaking paint observed in a cat enclosure. The cats had scratched an area on the doorway,
leading to the paint chipping and flaking off and accumulating on the floor where the cats had direct contact. This could
lead to illness of the animals if ingested. Facilities must be kept in good repair for the safety of the animals and to protect
them from illness or injury. The facility must address this issue.
2. A ventilation grate was observed with sharp metal and rough edges in a dog enclosure in building 2. The grate is at a
level where the dogs could come in contact with it. Sharp metal edges could cause injury to the dogs. The facility must
maintain enclosures in good repair in order to protect the animal from injury. The facility must correct these issues.
3. Three dog enclosures were observed to have the mesh between the enclosures coming apart from the vertical support
beams. This created a gap between the beam and the mesh, and the dogs were observed jumping up on to these areas
during the inspection. The dogs could potentially become injured if a foot or leg became lodged in these areas. The facility
must maintain enclosures in good repair in order to protect the animal from injury. The facility must correct these issues.
*********Correct by August 30, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
1. In Room 1014 there was flaking paint observed in a cat enclosure. The cats had scratched an area on the doorway, 
leading to the paint chipping and flaking off and accumulating on the floor where the cats had direct contact. This could 
lead to illness of the animals if ingested. Facilities must be kept in good repair for the safety of the animals and to protect 
them from illness or injury. The facility must address this issue.  
 
2. A ventilation grate was observed with sharp metal and rough edges in a dog enclosure in building 2. The grate is at a 
level where the dogs could come in contact with it. Sharp metal edges could cause injury to the dogs. The facility must 
maintain enclosures in good repair in order to protect the animal from injury. The facility must correct these issues.  
 
3. Three dog enclosures were observed to have the mesh between the enclosures coming apart from the vertical support 
beams. This created a gap between the beam and the mesh, and the dogs were observed jumping up on to these areas 
during the inspection. The dogs could potentially become injured if a foot or leg became lodged in these areas. The facility 
must maintain enclosures in good repair in order to protect the animal from injury. The facility must correct these issues.  
 
*********Correct by August 30, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
